title: note field
author: hungrysnake
body_snippet:
Is it possible to add a note field to the host config?
current i use description to add the note information but it is very limited.
hope this can be considered.

iterations.description: Feature request for a multiline notes/text area field on connections, since Description and UserField are single-line and limited — has community support across multiple users over several years.

comments.author: farosch
comments.snippet:
There aöready is a user field that can be used for anything that doesn't fit into the description field.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22905106/64508798-8e17ae00-d2de-11e9-837b-0248d1c0b44b.png)

comments.author: hungrysnake
comments.snippet: thanks @farosch to point out the user field. I notice that the User Field is more for a parameter using in the custom command line to call out an external tool. What I'm looking for is a text area that can enter multiline notes. user field and description is good for single one or short parameter.

comments.author: nLeonardt95
comments.snippet: In addition to that I would find it very useful to be able to attach a file to a connection and maybe access it with an external program.

notes:
AI triage (claude): Feature request for a multiline notes/text area field on connections, since Description and UserField are single-line and limited — has community support across multiple users over several years.
Approach: Add a Notes string property to ConnectionInfo, expose it as a multiline text area in the config panel, and persist it in XML and SQL serializers
